messageBody:

On Thu, Sep 4, 2008 at 7:33 PM, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
> On Thu, Sep 4, 2008 at 4:22 PM, Per Jacobsson <perjacobsson@...>
> wrote:
>>
>> Interesting idea. It sounds like something that would be very hard to do
>> from a unit testing perspective.
>
> It is very useful to put some concurrency pressure on your code. This
> doesn't guarantee that it's threadsafe but it gives you a reasonable
> idea.
>
> FYI, here is how it works in TestNG:
>
> @Test(invocationCount = 1000, threadPoolSize = 5, timeOut = 10000)
> public void f() { ... }
>
> This will invoke f() a thousand times from five different threads.
> Any invocation that doesn't return within 10 seconds will be marked as
> a failure.
>
> You can also specify timeout and thread pool size at the system level
> and TestNG will run all your tests from the thread pool you specified.
>
> --
> Cédric
>
